intro: Psychotria boyacana, commonly known as the Boyacá psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of Colombia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that contains several seeds. Psychotria boyacana is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to the high-altitude conditions of its native habitat.
